featured.text: Generally, they appear on both cheeks; a single dimple on one cheek is a relatively 31 phenomenon.
When a person smiles, the shorter-than-normal muscle pulls up the facial skin, which in turn creates a small indentation—or dimple—in the skin.
Such dimples tend to occur in families, and are assumed to be an inherited feature.
Not all dimples are formed by a genetic defect, though; some may appear due to the 36 of excessive fat on the face.

other.text: Though often associated with beauty, most dimples are actually a genetic 33 caused by shortened facial muscles.
In fact, some researchers believe that the 34 of dimples from parents to children takes only one gene.
Such dimples are not a permanent trait, for they vanish when the excessive fat goes away.
As they grow older and lose their baby fat, the dimples may 38 with time.
Some cultures are found to show preference for dimples on one’s cheeks, as the feature is claimed to be a sign of 32 .
If neither of the parents has dimple genes, their children will not 35 the trait.
Many babies, for example, have dimples on their 37 cheeks.
For those people who were born without 39 dimples, various methods can be applied to successfully create them.

definition.zh_def: 面部或皮膚上的小凹陷，通常出現在微笑或說話時。
definition.en_def: A small natural indentation in the flesh, typically found on the cheeks or chin, often appearing when a person smiles.
definition.example: She has a cute dimple on her left cheek when she smiles.
